Four kinds of deeds [mn57:15.4]: Dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results
Neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds
The process of taking the going forth, t: If the mendicants are satisfied, giving the going forth, the ordination into monkhood
Recognizing individual differences in this matter
If the mendicants are satisfied, giving the going forth, the ordination into monkhood
The realization of Venerable Seniya (a c: Living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute
Soon realizing the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life
Achieving with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness
Understanding that rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, and there is no return to any state of existence
